text.p: Dutch dairy company Nutricia International B.V. has increased its stake in the Hungarian dairy firm Hajdutej to 96.7 percent, Hajdutej said on Thursday.

Hajdutej said in a statement in the Budapest Stock Exchange's official gazette that Hajdutej managers sold shares with a total face value of 50 million forints to Nutricia on December 31, raising the Dutch firm's stake to 96.7 percent.
Hajdutej did not disclose the current amount of its registered capital, but it was 1.001 billion forints in May, 1996.
Hajdutej officials were not immediately available for comment.
The transaction with the managers was part of Nutricia's acquisitions of Hajdutej shares at the end of December.
Hajdutej said on December 21 that Nutricia held 79.6 percent of its shares.

Hajdutej also said in December that Nutricia was in talks with the Dutch firm Friesland Dairy Foods about international cooperation that would include the takeover of Nutricia's majority stake in Hajdutej by Friesland.
